block.p: Carol Marie Eggers, a television producer with MSNBC, the cable network, in Secaucus, N.J., and Brian Clement Haynsworth, a lighting designer in Brooklyn, were married yesterday at Our Lady of Perpetual Help Roman Catholic Church in Glenview, Ill. The Rev. John E. Flavin performed the ceremony.

Ms. Eggers, 34, will continue using her name professionally. She is a segment producer for ''The News With Brian Williams.'' She graduated from Northwestern University. She is a daughter of Joan H. Eggers and Dr. James D. Eggers of Glenview. Her father, who retired as an obstretician and gynecologist, practiced in Park Ridge, Ill. Her mother is a residential real estate agent at Koenig & Strey, in Glenview.

Carol Marie Eggers, a television producer with MSNBC, the cable network, in Secaucus, N.J., and Brian Clement Haynsworth, a lighting designer in Brooklyn, were married yesterday at Our Lady of Perpetual Help Roman Catholic Church in Glenview, Ill. The Rev. John E. Flavin performed the ceremony.

Ms. Eggers, 34, will continue using her name professionally. She is a segment producer for ''The News With Brian Williams.'' She graduated from Northwestern University. She is a daughter of Joan H. Eggers and Dr. James D. Eggers of Glenview. Her father, who retired as an obstretician and gynecologist, practiced in Park Ridge, Ill. Her mother is a residential real estate agent at Koenig & Strey, in Glenview.

Mr. Haynsworth, 31, graduated from Princeton University and received a master's degree in lighting design from Yale University. The bridegroom is the son of Patricia F. and Harry J. Haynsworth of St. Paul. His father is the president and dean of the William Mitchell College of Law there. The bridegroom is named for his father's cousin Clement F. Haynsworth Jr., who was nominated to the Supreme Court in 1969.
